comment.text:
I had gotten a giftcard for my birthday to spend at a Fifth Group restaurant, so we decided to check out Ecco! We made a reservation for a Friday evening and were seated pretty much immediately. There's parking along Cypress that's pretty easy through ParkMobile. 

The restaurant has such a cool vibe inside and is super intimate and cozy. We ordered a bottle of wine for the table and decided to order everything family-style. Our waiter was super helpful with recommendations. We got the charcuterie board, fried goat cheese balls, the speck flatbread, agnolotti, patatas bravas, and spaghetti al Nero. The fried goat cheese balls lived up to the hype and were absolutely the highlight of the meal!! The rest of the food was absolutely delicious and the perfect portions for 4 people to share. 

Overall, really cool dinner spot and really great food! Would definitely recommend for a special occasion.

Love love love. We made a reservation for a Friday evening and we were seated upon arrival. They have parking along cypress street which was an easy pick and quick walk!

We got a bottle of wine for the table and they have some bread as well. All of the wait staff was extremely nice!

We got a bunch of plates to share including the charcuterie board and friend goat cheese as an appetizer. The goat cheese was definitely the star of the show!!


For the main, we shared the speck flatbread, a ravioli, patatas bravas and spaghetti al Nero. The portions were generous and plenty to share and the patatas bravas were stellar. That flat bread was also massive!!

Overall, great food and the vibes of the restaurant are awesome!! Couldn't ask for a better experience

Ate here with a large party, so please consider my review in that context.

Apps - charcuterie board (very good!), chicory (I think?) salad (delicious), speck flatbread (great but difficult to eat, not for dates or a business dinner. It was very crisp, not well cut, making it hard to get the pieces apart and the speck was in big slices that fell off to the side or were hard to bite through gracefully).

Cocktails and wine were all delicious and with creative ingredients and names. Even the mocktails had rave reviews from our party.

I had the agnolotti as a main, which was vegetarian and really flavorful. the only issue was it arrived cold and with very different amounts of sauce for each person who ordered it. Our server was apologetic and took several plates away to get rewarmed. Service overall was stellar.

Would definitely give this place another go with a smaller group.

Came here with a friend on a Thursday evening and it was a cool experience! I had a glass of Riesling that was crisp and refreshing, and ordered the Pappardelle for my main course. The serving was generous and the food was very fresh. 
Our server was knowledgeable and kind, however, I am knocking off 1 star because we tried to pay with a giftcard but it somehow didn't work? Our server then kept the card and we had to ask for it back.. We initially thought it was then a faulty card due to this, but after looking up the details, realized that the card was perfectly fine. It was just sort of an odd experience in that sense, but the dining was good.

Came to eat dinner with the family on a random Thursday night for the first time and we were so pleased from start to finish! Called in to find out about the dress code and the hostess answered all my questions. Was able to make a reservation over the phone. Very pleasant staff. Our waiter  , michael McGill was so knowledgeable about everything on the menu! We LOVE when a waiter can guide us through a new restaurant experience! We ordered a great bottle of white wine - Picpoul de Pinet, which he recommended and we loved it! 

For our appetizer we ordered the lamb meatballs - OMG. So full of flavor and the garnishes gave a lot of great texture as well. We received bread service with oil on the side. The bread was warm and great but I wish the oil had some herbs or spices in it for dipping. For our entrees we ordered the duck and the sea bass. The duck was ordered medium well because we don't like any redness in our meat. It was so delicious, tender and just amazing! The cauliflower was also great in that dish. The sea bass was seasoned very well and was served with fingerling potatoes - very delicious. For dessert we ordered the baklava that was served over a cheesecake sauce with lemon sorbet on top and pistachios. Literally life changing! You have to try it! 

My 5 year old daughter was with us and we were able to order a flatbread cheese pizza. She is extremely picky and didn't eat much of it because it doesn't look like the typical pizza slices that she's accustomed to. She did enjoy pulling the mozzarella off the top and eating it. We ordered a side of fries and we all loved them. They came out hot!

Mike explained that the buckhead location has a similar vibe but an entirely different menu. We are excited to try that one! We signed up for the rewards system also.

I was in Atlanta for a business trip when a colleague recommended this place for dinner. I was able to make a reservation easily, and that night we dined at Ecco. 

The restaurant was dark and moody on the inside, perfect for a date night if you're interested in that. My coworker and i shared the fried goat cheese, which was oh so good. Our waiter said it was popular there, and I see why. For my main course, I ordered the seared swordfish. It was my first time trying swordfish, and hopefully not my last. It was also a great choice and I would definitely recommend it.

For my drink, I ordered the crowd pleasing vodka drink. It definitely pleased me so that's all that matters, right?

I'm so glad I had the chance to check this place out!

Great place to bring a very large group (50+) for a private event. The restaurant has a huge space and a very large sectioned off space in the back. The set menu also had a really yummy veggie/vegan option that was really well received from our groups. The starter appetizers also had a large variety and the prosciutto was very yummy. I think the steak we got as part of the fixed menu was good but nothing special.

We had an incredible dinner at Ecco while we were in town and staying at the Georgia Tech Convention Center. It's a short walk. Service was amazing. Very attentive and personable. The waiter recommended excellent wines and brought us samples. The fried goat cheese was a great start to the meal. (The roasted shrimp appetizer was unfortunately overcooked). The pappardelle with pork ragu was so delicious that we ordered a second plate. But the real highlight was the duck breast. One of the best I've ever had. Will definitely come back we I am ever in Atlanta again.

The food here is good and we had a lovely waiter.  We had some service issues/ delay when our order went in after a big party.  

Started with the beet top salad- delicious and sizable.
Lumache is tasty.

Red fish- good but could use a bit of sauce.
Duck breast - it came out a bit cold but communication and good service was key to a good ending.

This spot is upscale business casual and does a pretty decent happy hour. We stopped by befor headed to botanical gardens. Their fried goat cheese balls are to die for. So heavenly. Their old fashioned , our first round was excellent but inconsistent on the second round. Not sure why. I will definitely swing back as it's a good spot to kick back after a long day at work.

photos.caption: Fried goat cheese and Old Fashioned

comment.text:
This was probably the best dinner we had on our business trip to Atlanta.   One of the reasons it was so good was because so done else was paying.  But don't worry, it is worth the trip.

Parking, we Ubered, so I don't really know.  Sorry.

Service, it is loud and we had a large group so hearing us might have been a problem, but it wasn't.  Service was exceptional.

The food:
Fried Goat Cheese - AMAZING dish, get it even if you don't like goat cheese.  The honey sauce pairs so well.
Grilled Octopus - this was also amazing, but we shared it. I could eat one by myself.
Heirloom Tomato Salad - fresh, refreshing.
Broccolini - chard, we'll prepared but not my favorite (side to Swordfish)
Pappardelle - wonderful pasta choice, good size dish.
Swordfish - buttery texture and cut like bread.  This was so moist and flavorful.
Mussels - solid choice but a lot of work to get to the good stuff.
Crispy Duck - Phenomenal, period.  Best dish of the night.
Cheesecake - decadent, good not great.
Wine list - phenomenal.

Portions are light, so you do t have to save room for dessert.

Tips:
- Maker sure you go on their website and make reservations.
- Order the fried goat cheese, there are five pieces to share.
- Try the grilled squid, if you like it, because they do it right.
- Dessert was not a strong suit, choose an after dinner drink.
- Want to SPLURGE, go for the wine list and ask for suggestions.  They will help you pair the perfect wine with your food choices.

Always incredible. Great patio. Excellent wine & spirit options. Perfect service - never rushed nor long waits but perfectly timed friendly present service. Exquisite food. 
Always ask about the specials and fish. Often this is chefs chance to show their creativity & skills. 
Beautiful patio is perfect this time of year just watch for natural confetti (leafs) only adds to fall experience.

Delicious. Finally a place that doesn't over power their food with excessive salt. I could actually taste my food instead of feeling like I was ingesting spoonfuls of salt in every bite like other restaurants.
Excellent atmosphere and service. They had many gluten free options (including pasta). The food was delicious and portions were good.
Had the halibut which was great. We also shared the fried goat cheese balls. They were so good. The restaurant was pretty. We had good service. I would recommend this place for a nice dinner.

Placed a pickup order at 7:18 pm on Friday. I ordered the pommes frites and the dinner for two braised pork pappardelle. The order was set to be ready at 8 pm. I get there at 8 pm to pickup my order and the hostess asks for my name and I give it to her. She comes back and says nothing to me and cleans menus. She cleans menus for several minutes without even talking to me again or communicating about the status of my order. I ask her when she thinks my order will be ready and she says "no idea. I would cook it if I could." Finally a man, whom I can only assume to be the manager, inquired and helped me. I got the order at 8:15 pm and I got back home at 8:17 pm since it's a quick walk away. 

The dinner for two was missing the salad it was supposed to come with and the fries were missing the aioli. The pasta was fresh and hot and quite delicious. The noodles had a great bite to them. The braised meat was succulent and tender. The sauce was balanced and well flavored. The fries were a bit mushy so I assume they'd been sitting a bit longer waiting for the pasta. The bread was nice. It was crusty but had a soft interior. 

Overall, the level of service was mediocre especially with the prices they were charging. It's also a bit disheartening when they don't pack the items they advertise in their menus. I wouldn't recommend this place despite the tasty pasta I ate.

Okay dinner at Ecco Midtown. We walked in last Friday around 5:35 and asked for a table for two. The "nice" hostess said the bar is first come first serve... but what about a table for two...
We ordered grilled octopus and wood roasted mussels with frites. The octopus which was much smaller than expected came out about 5 minutes later followed by the mussels. The salsa verde was aight with the octopus, maybe something spicer would've made it better. The nduja "spicy sausage" gave the mussels a great taste! And the frites were not bad. 
I had the seared swordfish which was not bad but was terrible with the very bitter rapini. 
The black pepper rigatoni was a very healthy pasta choice and it was much better than the swordfish. 
Service at the bar was good, but there were several loud tables with squeaky laughs here and there.

Amazing in every aspect 
Loved it 
Would return no doubt 
Great service and fresh ingredients

Food was good, but I am not as enamored with this restaurant as other reviewers. Piquillo pepper appetizer was good, but it's basically four bites of smoked beef stuffed into a very small pepper - but it was tasty. Mixed lettuce salad  was good, but very small portion of just lettuce and radishes for the $13 price tag. Flatbread was okay, but in my opinion, nothing special. Friend loves the pappardelle, and I had the duck, 2 small strips for $40, which is overpriced. The duck was initially served undercooked, raw, and when it was re-cooked and returned to me, for some unknown reason, it was placed on an appetizer size plate Instead of the original serving dish. I thought that was kind of strange. Wines are pricey for the quality, and desserts were only ok in my opinion, not very appealing. At 7 pm on a Friday, they were out of 3 items..... Service was excellent, including hostess - our server was very knowledgeable, pleasant, and attentive.
What a way to end the work day at this cozy, tucked away restaurant nestled in the Midtown area of Atlanta! It had ample parking if you had to drive! The food and service were both good .

Fantastic meal at one of the best restaurants in midtown. We went prior to a show at the Fox. 
Bartenders were super helpful with wine choices.  Let me try a couple... 

I ordered the redfish special, which was a sunflower / eggplant coated crispy crust.  IT was outstanding.... served with summer squash.  FABULOUS! 

Highly recommend. Atmosphere is great, not too loud, good vibe!

First of all... GET THE GOAT CHEESE BALLS. Fantastic appetizer! 

We had a reservation for five, which we called and switched to four, then called again and switched it back to five and they were SO accommodating. Their cocktail menu is also fun... my two friends got the Long Live the Queen, to honor Queen Elizabeth II after her passing this week. I got the Georgia Caipirinha, which tasted good. Not exactly like the Brazilian Caipirinha's I've had but it IS the Georgia Caipirinha, after all.

Our server asked if we'd like bread and we said yes (always say yes to bread). He didn't let us know that we'd have to pay for it and brought us two bread baskets. I wish he had told us, but the two baskets split five ways wasn't expensive. He was a great server, though. 

My friend liked her sword fish and I enjoyed the pappardelle. It was pretty tasty. Lots of vegetarian and pescatarian options if you have dietary restrictions.

Great for a client/business dinner after work! The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated and our waitress was great. Gave thoughtful recommendations and a very thorough rundown of the menu. Appetizers were smaller portions but very delicious- would recommend grilled octopus and fried goat cheese. One of the specials was a steak that was cooked perfectly, and the desserts were all delicious (would recommend the lemon tart pictured here and cardinal).
When I lived in Midtown this was a go to spot of mine.  I enjoyed drinking wine at the bar and ordering charcuterie.  The service was always great and the vibe is really cool.

We took our top customers to dinner to celebrate their success.  What an amazing dinner!  Not only was the food delicious but setting up the reservation, accommodating food allergies was easy and a pleasure.  

The star of the evening was our server Eli, he is a wonderful, kind, attentive person made us all feel like we were his top priority because we were.  You can tell it was service from the heart!  

Thank Ecco, we'll be back soon.

I was in town for work and my local friend brought me here. It's a good place for drinks and dinner. The octopus was very tasty. The ambiance was cool and the service was good. 
*
Estaba en la ciudad por trabajo y mi amiga local me trajo aquí. Es un buen lugar para tomar una copa y cenar. El pulpo estaba muy sabroso. El ambiente genial y el servicio bueno.

A hidden gem!!! 

This location has top notch presence in all areas .... Servers , hosts , ambiance . 

The cleanliness of this place is nothing below sub par . The server  was very much top of the line . I appreciated her friendliness and knowledge of the menu . Her food and drink  suggestions were phenomenal !!! 

I enjoyed the taste and share lamb ; it's definitely a tease . 

The pasta was incredible and scrumptious! 

The food was great quality !!!

I give this place the green light !!

We made reservations for a little romantic dinner for our 10th wedding anniversary and the experience was everything we could have hoped for. Our server was very personable and the food was absolutely delicious!

Goat cheese balls & peppers, that's where you start! 

The swanky style, the lighting, the bar... all very much my style. There's always some party, group, fun celebrating happening here, which is great! My server was fantastic and so was the chef who came out and offered to make me a special melee of a topping for my lamb because I wanted something other than what came with it. SO good that I asked how it was made, only to sleep it off and forget: Looks like I have to go back and pray it's still being served.

The food was amazing, but the service was even better. Our server,Michael, was attentive and spent time chatting with us and explaining the menu and the meals as well as extensively discussed different wines with us. He was very sweet and you could tell he enjoyed his job and that made the experience all the better. 
Would 100% recommend coming here!

I went here with my boyfriend to celebrate a new job. 

Everyone here was extremely sweet, patient and most importantly the food was AMAZING. I'm a bit picky but I finished my meal soooo easily. I'm so impressed by this restaurant. And the location is so adorable and cute, I love Cypress street. 

Highlights: fried goat cheese, potato gnocchi, pappardelle. 

The drink La Vie en Rose was soo good if you like smoky. 

 I would definitely come again anytime. I love it so much!

photos.caption: Potato Gnocchi and Stuffed piquillo peppers and Pappardelle
Fried goat cheese and cocktails and a beer.

comment.text: We had a lovely experience sitting on the patio with friends on a Saturday night. The service was wonderful - our waiter was great, and we got to chat with the GM for a bit, too. I understand the hype for the goat cheese balls - they were unlike any I've tasted before with a thin, crispy shell - very delicate! We also split a mushroom flatbread, the chickpea starter, and the octopus, which were tasty as well. I'd say the flatbread was my favorite. We all had pasta for our entree, and I loved the rigatoni that came with a smoky red sauce - the noodles were the perfect al dente... chewy and irresistible. We had a streudel with gelato for dessert, and I would probably pass on that, but that's more of a me problem. I'm more of a cake/chocolate dessert girl. Would definitely come back here for a nice evening out.

Very disappointed with our most recent visit. Not sure if the management changed or if they are trying to save and cut costs. 
Came here on a Tuesday with the plan of having a few drinks and dinner. Ordered The King is dead and Open Sesame. Never seen smaller drink portions in my life. I should have taken a picture but I just got so disappointed that I forgot. Definitely not worth $14. 
We just finished the drinks and left to have dinner elsewhere. This used to be one of my favorite places, too.

What a great date night spot near the heart of Midtown!  We've been here a handful of times and plan to keep coming back. The restaurant has beautiful decor and provides a kind of dark and moody setting for dinner, it feels very upscale and intimate. 

Parking: they have valet available, but there is a lot right across the street that you can park at as well (I believe you pay at the meter). There's also limited street parking available. 

I'd recommend making a reservation before coming, they do allow walk-in service but it can get very busy on nights/weekends. 

The service was A+ perfect, our waitress was so friendly and took the time to explain the different menu options and help us narrow down our final selections. 

For an appetizer, if you come here and don't get the Fried Goat Cheese then you 10000% messed up. You HAVE to order this!! I'll be honest, I'm very hit or miss with goat cheese because I don't like overly pungent cheeses....they use a very mild goat cheese for this appetizer and it has just enough bite, paired perfectly with a drizzle of sweet honey. I could eat bowls full of this stuff! 

Based on our servers recommendations, we went with the Black Truffle Risotto and the special Crab Spaghetti. Per her recommendation, she said the risotto was delicious flavor wise but a slightly smaller dish, so she mentioned that "if we were hungry to get the spaghetti" - maybe I overthought it but I was expecting a bowl of spaghetti, but what came out was a very reasonable sized dish. I was hoping for $40 you'd get a little more, but it was still a decent portion. The Crab Spaghetti had delicious flavors, my only complaint was that the pasta was cooked Al dente to a fault....I felt like the pasta "bit back" a little too much and needed to be cooked maybe a minute longer. The crab was so delicate and not at all fishy. I do agree that the risotto was a delicious and flavorful dish - I felt like the dish could have done without the citrus, the flavors didn't necessarily pair so well together where I felt like it brought the dish together....again, this is coming from an untrained foodie so take that with a grain of salt. 

My big hang up is they took pinot noir off the menu by the glass!!  they have a burgundy on the menu that has a similar profile, but I was so bummed to see that it wasn't available by the glass anymore. I also think the dishes are a tad pricey for what you get. 

All in all, I definitely recommend Ecco for a nice date night experience!

They have two bartenders named Sara and Samantha that are the sweetest. I watched the slow morning lunch end and roll into dinner and they attended all customers very well given a natural instinct when coming in is to sit over at their large bar while waiting on remaining parties or if you're a single seater. I also while I sat here awhile on my own watched a few customers walk in having no knowledge of the place be a bit disrespectful with the tenders. I personally decided to leave this review purely based off the grace of Sara respectfully communicating with the customer and that's why I'm here. Go Sara and I'm sure on weekends in this busy downtown area she's a favorite even though this is my first time at Ecco.

Delicious meal! Very accommodating for a large group! We stuck to a wide variety of shared starters for the meal. The sausage and the mushroom flatbreads were huge hits, and I can't say enough good things about their fries!! So perfectly crispy and hot and salty. Also have excellent selections in the 5 meats and cheeses boards (the whipped ricotta is the bomb).
Great ambiance, food was average to moderate. I ordered the duck and it was cold once it got to my table and didn't have much flavor. I would go to this spot for appetizers and drinks.

Food, as always, superbly done and portioned correctly.

Service, as usual, impeccable.  Terrell et al did a great job.

We sat outside and enjoyed the atmosphere, and people watching on the street.

Wonderful food. It was my first time here and we were sat at tables in the bar area, which is perfectly fine, but I could not get a feel of the whole restaurant. Our server was fantastic and the food was great. The fried goat cheese is special and I highly recommend it. I love the pork belly and the crispy brussels sprouts. Nothing disappointed, and our server suggested a wine that paired perfectly with our meal. I can't wait to go back and get some more goat cheese!!
Ecco never disappoints! However, with the removal of the Pommes Frites from the menu, that is very disappointing!

Had dinner at one of my favorite Atlanta restaurants...Ecco. I had not been for several years, so I was hoping the food and service was just as good during the pandemic.

I love the ambiance. The restaurant has a sexy vibe and an open kitchen layout, perfect for a date night. 

The draw here is the fried goat cheese appetizer. Drizzled with honey and topped with fresh cracked pepper, it was even better than I remembered. I could easily eat a dozen of those things. 

I was sad to see their scallops weren't on the menu. I settled for the pork blade steak. Topped with whole wheat focaccia, that served as croutons, it was also topped with roasted tomatoes, arugula, frisée and a smoked tomato vinaigrette which was delicious! The pork blade steak was grilled a little too hard for my liking, where I could taste the char. The portion size was good however.

I had a side of pommes frites (French fries) which were seasoned and cooked well. They pair it with a sherry garlic aioli sauce that is divine.

For the drink I had the Bring Me The Shrubbery cocktail which consisted of Finlandia vodka, strawberry-basil shrub, soda and basil. It was a refreshing mix of flavors so good, I ordered two. 

The service is always excellent. The manager always comes over to check on each patron and all the servers always greet you and smile (they are all masked so the smile is assumed).

Definitely stays on my favorite list. Just bring back the scallops!

PARKING:
They have their own lot! I did not know this and paid for parking in the structure. Whoops!

STAFF:
Loved them all! I sat at the bar and everyone from the host to the bartenders were all extremely friendly and professional. Two thumbs up! 

FOOD:
$9 FRIED GOAT CHEESE BALLS - Very different and delicious! Would come back just for these! Once you bite into them, the cheese gushes our, so it can get a little messy if you take small bites like myself. It's covered in honey & black pepper. LOVED! 

$20 BRAISED PORK TAGLIATELLE PASTA - My food came out COLD which is why I deducted one star. Also, the couple who ordered this same dish next to me sent theirs back because it was cold also! I didn't feel like sending mine back because the staff was so pleasant I didn't want to complain, so I just ate it. But that would be my only complaint! Seems like it happens often, so I hope they find a solution. Other than it being cold, I wasn't super impressed. It wasn't bad, but nothing stood out to me. 

OVERALL:
A great staff can make all the difference in an experience! They were awesome and that's why I would come back. That and the fried goat cheese balls!

photos.caption: $20 Braised Pork Pappardelle - came out cold. The couple next to me also sent theirs back because it was cold. So apparently happens often!
$9 Fried Goat Cheese - DELICIOUS! Try 'em. Burst when you bite into them. Covered in honey and fresh black peppercorns.
$9 Fried Goat Cheese - DELICIOUS! Sounds like "Fair Food", but no no. Elevated dish. Must try.

comment.text:
I wasn't expecting much given that it was nearing 10pm on a Friday night and we were just coming for dessert/drinks/light bites, but we left impressed!

++ Mussels appetizer. We got this as a light bite, but the portion is actually pretty hefty, and with additional carbs ended up acting more like a main. The sauce was so delicious and well-balanced that we asked for additional bread to shlop it all up. 
+ Speaking of which, our waiter said that the bread was short in the kitchen and had to be toasted, etc. but it had a great custardy crumb and crispy crust and overall great structure, so I didn't notice any shortcomings at all!
+ Peach goat cheesecake presentation wasn't anything special, but was it YUM! The peach compote wasn't too sweet, very fruit-forward, and the goat cheese wasn't too strong. The crust was delicious and the texture of the goat cream cheese was light, creamy, and not too dense. Every bite was on point!
+ Got the Titanic cocktail and was a fan! The texture of the ice was subtle and the flavors were nicely balanced. Not a terribly alcoholic drink, but a well-composed and balanced one nonetheless!
+~ 3 people at the front of the house--the person at the host stand was super energetic and kept us updated on the table availability. And the other 2 at our table were attentive and kind, albeit a bit unenthusiastic.
- It took a bit to get us seated and started, but we did come in at a late hour, and had booked our reservation last-minute, so take that with a grain of salt.

All in all I'd come here again and recommend it to others in the downtown/midtown area!

So... Dinner was great.

I was a bit freaked out when we were seated by the open kitchen and the expeditor in plain view of me and my wife would taste food from a certain dish with a clean spoon for one taste.
After he tasted it he would send the food out to the customer. 
I have never seen this before but also never really looked.  I felt like
I was at the scene of an accident and could not look away......
I liked it. It's a different take, but good. The service was excellent, friendly great staff. Good cocktails.
Surprising high quality of the food. Everything is special: we tried cheese and starters, pasta and main dishes: very, very, very good. A bit too expensive.

We came to celebrate our anniversary and unfortunately our waiter commandeered our celebration. Our waiter must be trying to become an actor because he was putting on quite an act. He spent 10 minutes explaining how he can accommodate us if we are in a rush after we told him we had to be out of there at a specific time. He spent so much time talking about bubbles, romanesco and filet madame that we were stressed and rushing to get out. His voice frequently changed and he bowed and smiled awkwardly repeatedly. He was so phony and kept telling us how delightful everything is (not asking, telling). He was a bit much to say the least. 

As far as the food goes, the fried goat cheese balls were delicious. The duck breast was fatty though tasty. The gnocchi with lamb shoulder was tasty but small portion size. The waiter pushed the charred romanesco which was very disappointing. It was nearly raw and when we mentioned it being undercooked, the waiter said it is meant to be crunchy. He offered to have the chef cook it more but we didn't want to waste more time.  We didn't have time to taste dessert.

Don't be fooled like us into paying for bottled water at $7/bottle. Our waiter didn't tell us that tap was an option. We only realized our mistake after seeing other tables with short glasses of water. We had a $12 glass of Syrah which was smooth.

Overall this was a disappointing meal, though likely we would have had a more enjoyable experience had we had another waiter.

I wish I could write a more positive review as I enjoyed the crispy duck breast very much. Unfortunately, the service in this restaurant is extremely slow! We got our appetizer about 40 minutes after ordering it. The appetizer was fairly simple and tasted decent as we got their cured meats and cheese plate. However, the Agnolotti (English pea and ricotta purée, carrot butter, pea tendrils, carrot top oil) was a disaster. The peas were very hard and tasted raw but we didn't make a big deal out of it because we were tired of waiting. 
I initially wanted to give this restaurant 2 stars but it wouldn't do justice to the deliciously gooey Olive oil Gelato Sorbet and the Paris- Brest. If I go back there, I'll just go for their dessert.

Good food and good bottle of Burgundy. But agonizingly slow and rude service. They play loud music - continuously -  so it is hard to have discussion. Manager said he was sympathetic but wouldn't turn down music. No plans to return.

Atmosphere is laid back at the bar and our bartenders were great. The male bartender took great care of us and even laid our napkins down. I wish we could've caught his name. We had 2 of the signature cocktails.I had some sort of Georgia peach mojito, it was good. My boyfriend had a manhattan type drink with chocolate bitters he said it tastes like a sweet old fashioned. I would give a 5 star because the employees were great but the lighting made it hard to see anything, the berry thing they put on the charcuterie board was a no for me and better descriptions on the menu would be good because most people don't know what half the menu is.

photos.caption: Appetizer- Three for $18 cheese and meat
